basics.name: Anu Jajodia
basics.summary: Statistics at Carleton College. Working on ML for bioacoustics at UCSD

education.institution: Budapest Semesters in Mathematics/Aquincum Institute of Technology

work.name: UC San Diego
highlights: Engaged in cross-organizational partnerships with National Geographic and San Diego Zoo, coordinating project timelines and deliverables
Led development of interdisciplinary solutions for large-scale data processing and modeling
Collaborated with researchers to integrate statistics and computer science with domain expertise
Presented findings to researchers at Scripps Institute, National Geographic and the San Diego Zoo

work.name: Community Action Center Partnership
work.position: Statistical Consultant, Community Action Center of Northfield
highlights: Conducted comprehensive demographic and operational analysis to support policy development
Managed data collection and analysis processes for 30,000+ participant records, ensuring data quality and integrity
Wrote linear mixed-effects model to analyze effects of policy changes
Communicated findings to Community Action Center leadership

work.name: Metis Research
highlights: Supported senior analyst team in healthcare system efficiency analysis and improvement initiatives
Processed and analyzed large-scale datasets (2+ million records) to identify operational bottlenecks and opportunities
Delivered presentations in Italian to representatives from academia and government

publications.name: FishSense Mobile: A Mobile Device App for On-Deck Fisheries Management Operations

presentations.name: Engineers for Exploration San Diego Zoo Presentation
